abstract: Treasury Sec Jacob J  Lew says in email that he is strongly opposed to any efforts on part of Republicans in Congress to weaken 2010 Dodd-Frank Act, which overhauled financial system, and will recommend veto to any legislation that contains provisions to roll back aspects of law; Republicans are trying to insert changes to law in spending bill that must pass by December 11 to avoid government shutdown.
lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew said he would recommend that the president veto a crucial spending bill if it contains provisions intended to chip away at regulation of banks.

headline.main: Lew Vows to Resist Congressional Maneuvers to Weaken Dodd-Frank
headline.print_headline: Lew Vows to Resist Congressional Maneuvers to Weaken Dodd-Frank

snippet: Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew said he would recommend that the president veto a crucial spending bill if it contains provisions intended to chip away at regulation of banks.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
